text.text: Dianne Tookenay is a band member of Brunswick House First Nation in Ontario and has been a director of CCW since June 15, 2015 and has been a director of Granada Gold Mine Inc., a company listed on the TSXV, since April 2017. Ms. Tookenay holds a Certificate in Mining Law from Osgoode Hall Law School, York University, a Joint Masters of Public Administration degree from the University of Manitoba, a Bachelor of Administration degree from Lakehead University and Native Band Management and Indian Economic Development Diplomas from Confederation College Applied Arts and Technology. Ms. Tookenay has accumulated a wide breadth of business development and advocacy roots within the First Nation communities.
